info.title: MTS Device API
info.description:
RESTful API for managing MTS IoT devices (mPower Edge Intelligence platform).

This API provides comprehensive device management capabilities including:
- System configuration and monitoring
- Cellular connectivity management
- Network configuration (WiFi, Ethernet, VPN)
- User authentication and authorization
- LoRa network management
- SCADA protocols
- Docker container management
- Firmware updates and diagnostics

## Authentication

The API uses session-based authentication with cookies. Users must first authenticate
via the `/api/login` endpoint to obtain a session cookie, which is then used for
subsequent API requests.

## API Structure

The API follows a resource-based structure where most endpoints follow the pattern:
- `GET /api?fields=<resource>` - Retrieve resource data
- `PUT /api/<resource>` - Update resource configuration
- `POST /api/command/<action>` - Execute commands
- `DELETE /api/<resource>/<id>` - Delete resource items

## Permissions

The API supports role-based access control (RBAC) with three built-in roles:
- **Admin**: Full access to all endpoints and operations
- **Engineer** (User): Read and modify access to most configuration
- **Monitor** (Guest): Read-only access to status and monitoring data

get.description: Retrieve device availability and policy information

Generic endpoint to query one or more resources. Resources are specified
via the `fields` query parameter as a comma-separated list.

Examples:
- `/api?fields=system` - Get system information
- `/api?fields=system,cellular,users` - Get multiple resources
- `/api?fields=system/capabilities` - Get specific nested field
